data.what_is:
IntelligenceBank is a marketing operations platform that helps marketing teams work faster, stay compliant and stay on brand.

We do this through best practice briefs and campaign workflows, proofing and mark-up tools, digital asset management, creative templates, disclaimer engines, online brand portals, and reporting tools that work together to simplify and automate all your brand, creative and marketing processes.
data.product_description: IntelligenceBank is the ideal Digital Asset Management software for streamlining processes around your marketing content and protecting your brand.  Our beautifully designed platform simplifies managing creative projects as well as sharing, distributing and reporting on brand assets.IntelligenceBank is not just about storing and sharing files online, but rather, the processes you need to work faster and stay on brand. IntelligenceBank is continuously rated as the #1 DAM provider for usability, satisfaction and easiest to do business with. We guarantee a successful implementation and provide you with 'six-star service in a five-star world'. Our cloud platform is optimized for speed and performance, with our backend framework being 15x faster than other systems. This means when you are searching for thousands or millions of large files, you will have a desktop experience in the cloud. Last but not least, we are passionate about innovation. We listen to our customers and we continually release complimentary upgrades.

features.name: Data Import & Export Tools
features.content: Ability to input, modify and extract data from the application in bulk through a structured file.

features.name: Integration APIs
features.content: Application Programming Interface - Specification for how the application communicates with other software.  API's typically enable integration of data, logic, objects, etc with other software applications.

features.name: Breadth of Partner Applications
features.content: To what extent are there partner applications readily available for integrating into this product?  Partner applications typically provide complementary, best of breed functionality not offered natively in this product.

features.name: Customization
features.content: System provides sufficient customization to meet business requirements

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application.

features.name: Customizable brand guidelines
features.content: Allows users to create brand guidelines at a company level, channel level, and campaign level.

features.name: Collaboration
features.content: Provides collaboration tools to allow teams to share and comment on assets.

features.name: Templates
features.content: Provides premade organization templates to help users organize and structure their brand assets.

features.name: Building and Personalizing Emails
features.content: Create and design emails with an editor; manage templates; personalize dynamically

features.name: Sending Outbound Emails
features.content: Create targeted lists, schedule and manage bulk email sending.

features.name: Manage Email Deliverability
features.content: Ensure inbox delivery. Includes opt-in management, bounce handling, unsubscribe processing, suppression lists, email preview, spam checking, link validation, and delivery monitoring.

features.name: Automated Email Responses
features.content: Set up automated nurturing emails based on events, online activities, and lead scores

features.name: Landing Pages and Forms
features.content: Build customized landing pages and lead capture forms for specific marketing campaigns to maximize conversion and to capture the right qualifying information.

features.name: Dynamic Content
features.content: Dynamically customize emails, forms, and landing pages for specific segments of customers and prospects.

features.name: A/B Testing
features.content: Test alternate versions of emails, landing pages, and forms. Learn what works, maximize response rates, and increase conversion.

features.name: Mobile Optimized
features.content: Support mobile-optimized emails, online forms, and landing pages.

features.name: Search Tracking and Optimization
features.content: Track performance of keywords and links in major search engines.  Measure search rankings and performance.  Improve page-level SEO with tools to diagnose and improve page performance.  Integrate with Google AdWords.

features.name: Marketing Lead Database
features.content: A marketing lead database is the system of record for your most important marketing asset: your leads and contacts. Includes a view of all marketing interactions between each prospect and your company, including website visits, email clicks, scoring changes, and data updates/history.

features.name: Data Quality Management
features.content: Data quality consists of deduplication, cleansing, and appending your marketing database.

features.name: Segmentation
features.content: Segment your database and build list of target leads and contacts.  Filter on demographic and company attributes (title, company size, location) as well as behavioral filters and CRM information.

features.name: Lead Scoring and Grading
features.content: Automatically qualify and score leads based on demographics as well as prospect online behaviors, including recency and frequency. Assign your own weights to determine lead scores for prioritization.

features.name: Lead Nurturing
features.content: Automate drip marketing campaigns that send relevant messages over time, based on prospect behaviors and pre-defined campaign steps.

features.name: Online Behavior Tracking
features.content: Track which emails a prospect opens and clicks, what web-pages they visit, what keywords they use, even what they say on social networks.

features.name: Automated Alerts and Tasks
features.content: Create tasks automatically and provide real-time sales alerts over email, RSS or mobile device.

features.name: CRM Lead Integration
features.content: Sync lead, contact, account, and opportunity information with your CRM system.

features.name: Program ManagementView full feature definition
features.content: Manage marketing campaigns and programs across multiple channels, including online ads, video campaigns, mobile, virtual events, and social media. Create and optimize program assets such as landing pages, emails, campaigns, and lists. Track program objectives, results, and costs to assess the program ROI.

features.name: Event / Webinar Marketing
features.content: Streamline the entire event process, including personalized invitations, registration, reminders, and post-event follow-up.  Integrate with online meeting tools like WebEx, Adobe Connect, GoToWebinar.

features.name: Calendaring
features.content: Maintain a marketing calendar across multiple groups. Manage the calendar for the entire marketing department, from promotions to content to PR.

features.name: Budgeting
features.content: Manage all aspects of marketing investments, including assigning top-down budgets to various groups and divisions, planning marketing spending across programs, tracking open-to-spend, ensuring budget compliance, coordinating work-flows and permissions, and reconciling plans with actual invoices.

features.name: Social Listening
features.content: Monitor what leads and contacts say on sites such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, blogs, and online communities.  Incorporate into your lead and customer DB and use social insights to segment prospects.  Trigger campaigns, and update lead scores.

features.name: Social Sharing
features.content: Add intelligent social share buttons to your campaigns and content.  Track who is sharing your content and driving conversions.

features.name: Social Campaigns
features.content: Schedule automated posts to one or more social accounts; use or integrate with URL shortening services; and measure likes, comments, replies, and retweets.

features.name: Social Media Engagement
features.content: Social apps including polls, sweepstakes, and referral programs can enhance audience engagement.  Include these on your website, landing pages, Facebook pages, and emails.

features.name: Social Media Advertising
features.content: Amplify brand and community stories; Reach customers by social profile and activity; Optimize social ad campaigns in real-time

features.name: Basic Reporting
features.content: Access pre-built and custom reports and dashboards to measure leads by source/campaign/month, email performance, landing page performance, and web and social activity. Create report subscriptions that can automatically send updates to your team and executives.

features.name: Web Analytics
features.content: Track which pages prospects and customers visit and how often they come back.  Capture the history in database for lead scoring and sales intelligence. Use anonymous company look-up to identify anonymous visitors.  Send alerts to sales reps of which of their prospects and customers web activity.

features.name: ROI Analytics
features.content: Measure leads, prospects generated, pipeline, revenue, investment, and ROI by marketing channel or program. The result is that you can see which marketing investments are generating the greatest return and get visibility into how marketing budget should be allocated going forward.

features.name: Revenue Analytics
features.content: Analyze how leads flow through the funnel by measuring stage to stage conversion rates and velocity.  Allocate pipeline and revenue credit among all the marketing activities that have successfully touched an opportunity as it moves through the pipeline.

features.name: SEO / Keyword Analytics
features.content: Monitor and track how you rank for relevant keywords on major search engines and compare your overall performance to competitors.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
- I like the customer support. They have taken a lot of energy and put it into ensuring their customers are happy and successful.
- I have also had success integrating IntelligenceBank's API to automatically share content in a mobile app (Ram Dass Be Here Now)
- API was also used to do a transfer from another DAM into IntelligenceBank very quickly; we transferred the raw data of 23,000 resources with attached metadata in less than 72 hours.
- They use Amazon S3 as the storage source which makes uploading and downloading a breeze.
- Our team has found it to be extremely easy to use compared to the last DAM we were on.
- Every day the DAM is used by our team and so far every issue has been resolved with ease.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
If you don't have a technical person on staff to be the Administrator, you will be relying heavily on the customer success representatives to assist you during the initial first few months. This is not a knock on the platform at all, but it is very modular and there are many ways to use it.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Social Media Content generation (using it like an archive to pull old content out and make into "fresh")
- Storage and organization of important resources
- Populating the content for an iOS/Android app and using IB's CDN to deliver quickly around the world
- AI tools in the future will be used to generate transcripts + descriptions of hundreds of hours of undescribed content

initial_reviews.review_title: IntelligenceBank is a simple enough platform
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
IntelligenceBank is an easy way to keep all our marketing assets in one place. The search function is thorough and downloading the pieces is nice with multiple options.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
My main issue with our IntelligenceBank is not the platform itself but more how it has been set up for our company. It is a relatively new system though so I'm sure that, with the ease IntelligenceBank affords, it will continue to be worked on to make it work best for us.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
I believe that the future of IntelligenceBank for our company will give us the ability to update pieces in the platform to have more autonomy and to take some of the workload off of our creative team. That would be exceptionally helpful to our local marketing teams.

initial_reviews.review_title: Everything they do is top quality
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Using IntelligenceBank is super easy for the average user. I use it about once per month and every time I log in, the number of features provides for my every need. It's super simple to integrate into your every day work flow! The ease of implementation is so user friendly.  Customer support is always there to help in time of need.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I don't know of any downsides to using the service. Everything is first rate!

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Whenever I need a specific resource, IntelligenceBank always has everything organized and easy to find so I can maximize my productivity.

initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I started using intellegence bank over 5 yrs ago and I think the experience has been great. I haven't had any issues using it and it was easy to onboard other designers/requesters. Their customer support is always on point and they are very responsive. I use it everyday for over 10 hours. I love how we can customize the features throughout the experience.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I think sometimes new updates may have a learning curve. It would be great to receive notifications of the changes.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Prior to adopting Intelligence Bank, we utilized Workfront, which featured an overwhelming array of elements on its platform. The transition to Intelligence Bank has noticeably streamlined project management, making it more user-friendly for both requesters and designers.

The ability to easily upload and manage assets.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Wish I could drag and drop folder and assets into different areas instead of having to go through the folder hierarchy. Wish I could package a specific amount of assets within an existing folder and then link them to share with a user. I often need to show people where certain assets are within a folder but don't want to just resend the folder.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am an agency user tracking for KFC who uploads and manages their library of content for their many franchisee/regional users.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great tool for managing photos and brand materials
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
We've come a long way since we began with IB and continue to enjoy its functionality and ease of use. We're about to begin implementing templates, and are eager to meet with our rep about his support in doing so. I still feel IB's support is one of it's biggest selling points.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Presently, there are no real dislikes to mention that haven't been addressed or are in the process of getting there.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are definitely solving the issue of "where's that photo" and "does it have a release." Those are two that we've struggled with at my company, primarily because my own team members over the years haven't loaded things into our present system properly, tagged things or bothered to link photos with releases. Intelligence Bank is really helping us set a good pace for loading in our assets, giving us some best practices are for doing so and making sure we're working towards the end result. I think the best benefit has been our rep so far and the relationship we have with her in regards to setting goals and having questions/issues dealt with quickly.
We're about to begin the template use and look forward to testing it with our company.

initial_reviews.review_title: Intelligence Bank offers a great opportunity for marketers everywhere.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank website is simple to read, easy to navigate, and alluring.  There is a customer support help chat that pops up at the bottom in case the user needs assistance at any time.  The categories are clearly labeled.  I was able to move through the site to find all of the options provided by the company.  The offering places marketing content at the user's ready.  A user can easily search for any type of content to fit their current need and use it without fear of legal issues.  The site offers multiple packages at different price points to satisfy businesses whether large or small.  The monthly payment allows the user to frequently use the site as much as they need to.  They also offer webinars to help the user with the product.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I wish there were even smaller packages for smaller businesses with less of a budget.  This product seems amazing, but the price may be too steep for a company with less funding.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
This product cuts down the time to create digital content.  You can share the content across all of the social media sites.

all_reviews.review_title: Great customer support and product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
- I like the customer support. They have taken a lot of energy and put it into ensuring their customers are happy and successful.
- I have also had success integrating IntelligenceBank's API to automatically share content in a mobile app (Ram Dass Be Here Now)
- API was also used to do a transfer from another DAM into IntelligenceBank very quickly; we transferred the raw data of 23,000 resources with attached metadata in less than 72 hours.
- They use Amazon S3 as the storage source which makes uploading and downloading a breeze.
- Our team has found it to be extremely easy to use compared to the last DAM we were on.
- Every day the DAM is used by our team and so far every issue has been resolved with ease.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
If you don't have a technical person on staff to be the Administrator, you will be relying heavily on the customer success representatives to assist you during the initial first few months. This is not a knock on the platform at all, but it is very modular and there are many ways to use it.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Social Media Content generation (using it like an archive to pull old content out and make into "fresh")
- Storage and organization of important resources
- Populating the content for an iOS/Android app and using IB's CDN to deliver quickly around the world
- AI tools in the future will be used to generate transcripts + descriptions of hundreds of hours of undescribed content

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
So far we have not really seen any downsides

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
IntelligenceBank is solving the problem of scattered assets, some in directories that are not accessible by all. By using the DAM, we can have all our assets in one cemtral location that is easily shareable. We also are using it to host images and files on our new website. It is benefiting us by not having imges and files stored on webservers, helping speed up load times.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for managing photos and brand materials
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
We've come a long way since we began with IB and continue to enjoy its functionality and ease of use. We're about to begin implementing templates, and are eager to meet with our rep about his support in doing so. I still feel IB's support is one of it's biggest selling points.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Presently, there are no real dislikes to mention that haven't been addressed or are in the process of getting there.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are definitely solving the issue of "where's that photo" and "does it have a release." Those are two that we've struggled with at my company, primarily because my own team members over the years haven't loaded things into our present system properly, tagged things or bothered to link photos with releases. Intelligence Bank is really helping us set a good pace for loading in our assets, giving us some best practices are for doing so and making sure we're working towards the end result. I think the best benefit has been our rep so far and the relationship we have with her in regards to setting goals and having questions/issues dealt with quickly.
We're about to begin the template use and look forward to testing it with our company.

all_reviews.review_title: Intelligence Bank offers a great opportunity for marketers everywhere.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank website is simple to read, easy to navigate, and alluring.  There is a customer support help chat that pops up at the bottom in case the user needs assistance at any time.  The categories are clearly labeled.  I was able to move through the site to find all of the options provided by the company.  The offering places marketing content at the user's ready.  A user can easily search for any type of content to fit their current need and use it without fear of legal issues.  The site offers multiple packages at different price points to satisfy businesses whether large or small.  The monthly payment allows the user to frequently use the site as much as they need to.  They also offer webinars to help the user with the product.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I wish there were even smaller packages for smaller businesses with less of a budget.  This product seems amazing, but the price may be too steep for a company with less funding.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
This product cuts down the time to create digital content.  You can share the content across all of the social media sites.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?

all_reviews.review_title: Good Overall Product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Overall, this product has been good for our company. The uptime has been great as I've never had issues with the system being down. Customer service with our account rep has also been good. The product does what it says as advertised for keeping our assets straight.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
There are a few operational nuances and bugs that have come up with using the software. For example, the uploader can get randomly stuck and wipe out all of your progress, but this has become more stable over time. The approvals section for new assets could use massaging. One of the biggest issues is the view for Assets vs Folders.  People have to switch between the two, and it gets confusing to end users when they're not paying attention. Lastly, I wish they did all-inclusive pricing with everyone receiving the same roles to upload with administrative responsibility going to a few select users.  When you run a company with 7000+ people, it's hard to justify spending money for individual licenses.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a DAM for our company because the assets were beginning to be too much to hold on Google Drive.  When you have 120+ locations, there needed to be a central location to get all of the data.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?

For example, the uploader can get randomly stuck and wipe out all of your progress, but this has become more stable over time. The approvals section for new assets could use massaging. One of the biggest issues is the view for Assets vs Folders.  People have to switch between the two, and it gets confusing to end users when they're not paying attention. Lastly, I wish they did all-inclusive pricing with everyone receiving the same roles to upload with administrative responsibility going to a few select users.  When you run a company with 7000+ people, it's hard to justify spending money for individual licenses.

all_reviews.review_title: IntelligenceBank continues upgrades to offer a smart solution to your digital asset managing needs.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Ease of use, great uploading and keywording options. Download and sharing options are really good too. Love the Collections option. The Bulk Uploading option is the one I use the most when uploading, it saves time when uploading photos from one particular photo shoot, and adding the keywords and filters as I go.
Upgrades have been made for reviewing photos, and for bulk uploading and AI tagging your photos.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Would still like to have a larger preview for the photos, but they have updated the preview so all information about the asset is visible when viewing.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
We chose IntelligenceBank because it did not have items that were not needed; it is straightforward. The initial set-up required some explaining as far as the structure, and a lot of work was required on our part to get it set up as far as the categories, and art for the folders and icons. We looked at other, much more expensive software, but they had options for tracking, job status and marketing requests, and more that we didn't need. The information I needed to see upfront when looking at pictures was the file name, file type, and size, which is shown at the bottom of each item. Other companies didn't show this, which ruled them out immediately. Sharing files and collections of items is easy with email links. It is also helpful to have the different user types for admin, publish, and preview. This lets you control how each group can access your library.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
I only use the Digital Image Library. It helps keep all our images, logos, and templates in one place for easy access and searching. It also helps with version control, approval of photos, and many download sizing options. We had multiple folders for each photo session, and it was difficult to search for the image needed without any keywords.
Being able to share whole collections of photos with people within the company is very useful, as well as outside contacts.

all_reviews.review_title: Consistently improving document management system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I like being able to add filters to my team's assets that we can use for sorting our stored assets. I also like being able to use different levels of access for our team members. I also like the new(ish) Markup feature and the ability to upload new versions within a markup task.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I dislike the clunkiness look of it and slowness of it, but I suspect some of that is because of our humongous archives. I also  have trouble with the amount of options on the dropdown menu for each asset, and find myself frustrated with navigating it. I also think some of the labels are confusing and don't make it easy to intuit what they're for.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
If you have a big group of people who need to use the software with varying levels of access, make sure to clarify those users and the type of access you want them to have and why. Work closely with your IB rep while you set up your system to make sure you're doing it correctly. There are some interdependencies for users, groups, and other features that you may not realize are there, and your IB rep can help you navigate that structure.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the problem of having a source of truth for our documents, and also trying to create and maintain an easy review process for high numbers of reviewers in groups that frequently vary. We've benefitted from a much smoother review process and a more reliable (though still difficult) asset library.

all_reviews.review_title: A fabulous digital asset management system!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
The interface is so easy to use. I love how I always know that the asset in the DAM is the final asset. I also love that you can use metadata to search and view a large number of assets for a kind of audit view.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
There are a lot of options to make sure are clicked on or off and sometimes the jargon can get confusing. A simple click of a box can solve a huge problem, or cause one.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Make a plan for onboarding the software outside of your design team. Roll out in segments, not all at once. Spend dedicated time setting up your folder structure and meta data from the start.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
There is no question about what version is final and it has helped cut steps out of our marketing library posting process. It is quickly becoming our single source of truth.

all_reviews.review_title: IntelligenceBank
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I have been using IntelligenceBank for about 4 years now, and I'd have to say the ease at which I can create and tweak form templates is my favorite part. It provides you with different types of entry fields that you can drag and drop to reorganize. Because we mainly use IntelligenceBank as a data repository, being able to easily create new registers and tweak old ones makes the solution very useful. The ability to export data quickly is great, as is the ability to apply filters to each register to quickly find the specific entry you're looking for.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Bulk importing data from spreadsheets can be a frustrating experience. There have been multiple times where I get unexplained errors and have to do smaller, bite sized imports rather than a more convenient large one. I am usually able to find work arounds for these issues, but it can be time consuming and frustrating.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
I have used IntelligenceBank as a data repository mainly. For this purpose, I would recommend it, though I also know that the solution has more potential than my organization is currently using it for. The IntelligenceBank team has showed me how to use their solution in different ways, like managing marketing resources and creative portfolio management. If these were needs that my organization did not currently already have a solution for, we would have discussed using IntelligenceBank for those.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
IntelligenceBank is great as a data repository. It solves our data tracking needs. We currently do not use the built-in dashboard capabilities, but there are ways to create and export reporting straight from the IntelligenceBank solution.

all_reviews.review_title: Super Simple and Easy to Use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
The best thing about IntelligenceBank is that it is super easy for our partners to use and find the materials they need to be successful. It does a great job at keeping everything organized and professional looking.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The only thing that I don't really like is that the implementation process was kind of all over the place. Web2Print templates are also hard confusing to upload if you didn't make them.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
IntelligenceBank is a great Digital Asset Manager. They are willing to work with you to make sure all your needs are met and assist with anything you need.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had a word press site for all of our partner-facing content and it wasn't the easiest to navigate. With IntelligenceBank we can update content easily, add videos, and so much more that we couldn't have on the word press site. Also partners can register and gain access to the content right away on IntelligenceBank. You can also share links to your content with people who don't have access to the site which is great because if you have a newsletter or site people can click that and get the content. They also have a co-brand feature that our partners really like. It makes the content more personal to them.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for staff members to access the most current resources and versions.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I find it easy to organize the assets. Having the ability to apply keywords to multiple files upon bulk uploading saves time.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The folder/subfolder hierarchy is not clear to new users or to those who access the DAM infrequently. I much prefer the previous layout.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
In addition to assigning keywords, I highly recommend using comprehensive file naming conventions for the assets you plan to upload. For instance, instead of using the file name: DSC_0637.JPG for a photo, consider "tradeshow2021_exhibithall.JPG." It will help users when searching for assets.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our marketing & graphics team was constantly being interrupted by requests for content. The DAM allows staff to access headshots, logos, and other resources on their own.  Since we are all working remotely now, the DAM allows our design and marketing team to access files.

all_reviews.review_content:

My favorite thing about Intelligence Bank's DAM is the ease of bulk uploading and bulk data adding. You can add keywords to multiple images and make bulk changes, which I find really helpful and a lot easier to use than my previous DAM.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
There may be an easier way, but the only thing that I dislike is that you can't select multiple images from different folders, you can however select and add them to a downloads folder - but sometimes by habit I will select multiple and click out and realise I've lost them.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Its worth getting more information to find out if this product is right for you. It has helped our organisation a lot.

We have managed to remove all our digital assets from our general W drive, which was taking up a lot of room, we are also able to data manage all of the images a lot easier, and we can also have archived folders to keep images safe but not in use.

all_reviews.review_title: Integrated DAM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I love the ease that IntelligenceBank DAM rolled out. It was so easy. The auto-tagging feature was a dream, and IntelligenceBank DAM was very helpful when we needed to auto-tag 37,000+ photos.  We like how with IntelligenceBank DAM, we can expand storage as needed, share files with external users, and of course, easily scale up if/when we want to.  We also really like the integration with Adobe Creative Cloud, which means we can access our DAM when creating files.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
There's not much to dislike about this system. There are moments when I think "that could be a little easier to accomplish" but those instances are minimal to non-existent (mostly user interface). The funny thing is that, I find that the IntelligenceBank DAM team regularly seems to be thinking through their interface and addressing them. They seem to bring new solutions and fresh thinking to their platform every time I log on.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
I highly recommend IntelligenceBank DAM. It has a number of great features that really allowed it to become a seamless part of the creative process within our communications team. I don't know how we got anything done without them.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We no longer have to manage our 37,000+ photos on our in house Windows based server. Moving to IntelligenceBank DAM was the best decision we ever made and at a price we can afford. I would highly recommend IntelligenceBank DAM as the solution for Digital Asset Management.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Digital Asset Manager (DAM)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Easy to use and organize the files into folders. It helps to keep content files not only contained but with the latest version available, becoming the single source of truth - especially valuable for global organizations.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The downside of using this software is that it requires a strong internet connection to upload videos, and it may take longer than usual to upload it, mainly if compared with the speed of loading a file, for example.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
I would recommend having a plan and structure to organize the folders, tags, and relevant fields for each asset that will be added to the platform for easy filtering.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main benefit for the organization is to have a single source of truth (SSOT) content to avoid miscommunication between the areas and the use of the most recent available files. The ability to share URLs and keep those URLs updated with the latest version of the file is also very beneficial.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?

all_reviews.review_title: IntelligenceBank DAM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Relatively easy to set up the software with the help of IntelligenceBank people.  Once this was complete, we have been able to make the majority of the changes internally.
We have a very limited use case for the software, so training was not too much of an issue
Clean interface and good integration with InDesign
Being a small Australian-based company has allowed us to speak directly to the product team and enabled us to influence, to some extent, their roadmap - adding much-needed features in a timely manner.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
We have had some limited issues with the InDesign connecter - but thankfully, these have been resolved quickly with little fuss.
User adoption - not really a limitation of the system itself, more a by-product of internal process failings!

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We operate in multiple states around the country and previosuly images we relatively isolated to each operation.  With the use of the DAM we have been able to socialise all images around the country.
In addition, using their API we have been able to auto-upload documents and testimonials that otherwise would have had to be manually uploaded - which tends to lead to backlocks and missed files.

all_reviews.review_title: Simplicity
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I find IntelligenceBank a very simple platform for managing my database of more than 300 Contractors. Being completely new to this type of administration role, the program was very easy to navigate and I felt confident after just a few days of use to explore more within the software. Many of my team of Contractors that use the database are time poor and not necessarily tech savvy, but it's very rare that I'm asked for help to utilise the system, as they also find it easy to use. Any issues that I have found, have been dealt with very quickly by the excellent IntelligenceBank Helpdesk team and always resolved to my satisfaction.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I think the only thing that could be improved are some of the reporting functions. Allowing for more parameters to be applied to my reports would allow me to filter the information without the need for me to do it myself, after producing the report, saving time. Having said that, the reports are very easy to use and are produced in a format that is simple for me to edit.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
My main area of concern is ensuring that more than 300 Contractors are licenced with up-to-date permits, to complete the work that my business requires. The system allows me to set parameters for how often and when the Contractors receive notifications, and the method of communication. Automating all of this means that once I set these fields, I no longer need to worry about the follow-up. It happens in the background, allowing me to focus on other tasks.

The in-built print template editor makes adjusting pricing or copy for international markets a breeze.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic customer service delivering a transformation to our marketing processes
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
The entire setup process with Intelligence Bank has been seamless. We were provided with expert and dedicated customer service by Intelligence Bank employees who were always trying to understand our needs to set up the DAM in the best way possible. In terms of the software, the tagging and filtering opportunities are a game-changer for me. It has already saved me so much time and I know that we are future-proofing our marketing resources and processes by utilizing the DAM in this way. The software is very robust and has been molded perfectly to our needs.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
On the whole, I can see no downsides to using Intelligence Bank software. However, depending on what kind of storage solution you currently are using, you may need to be ready to make some adjustments to your processes. For example, Intelligence Bank has no 'drag and drop' ability similar to Dropbox or Sharepoint - i.e., everything has to be tagged with filters and further information (the amount that this is necessary, however, is customisable). This makes it a great solution for assets but can sometimes be frustrating when you want to quickly share something with someone.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
I highly recommend others to use IntelligenceBank. You are in very capable hands and there is a great possibility that your marketing processes will be made highly more efficient and seamless.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are in the process of drastically improving our legal compliance approval process with the help of Intelligence Bank. We have realised how much time we can save on our end (marketing team) in submitting assets for approval but also the time of our compliance team, who now have one central point to visit to review and approve marketing materials, as well as provide comprehensive and specific feedback within any document. Furthermore, we have realised that Intelligence Bank can be a central source of truth for what has been approved, due to the thorough audit trail and formal approval process.

all_reviews.review_title: We love the DAM's robust tagging system and customizable interface
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
We are only using the DAM component right now and have been very happy with it overall. At the initial implementation, we were able to specify category filters unique to our industry and brand, and add and remove values ourselves for ongoing maintence. The organization system is flexible and the interface is intuitive. We were also able to work with the IB team to build a custom skin for the web interface that's just a nice extra touch.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Our custom fields don't appear via free text search, rather you have to use the filtering system. The new facial recognition is an add-on feature and during our selection process, it was implied to be included when it launched. It can be slow to load assets, but I don't think any other system would do better given the file sizes we're working with.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our entire team can locate assets independently, organically, and at any time rather than relying on memory or another team member.

all_reviews.review_title: It does the job, but room for improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
- It houses all our digital assets and is great for brand management
- The interface is modern and clean
- There are frequent updates/maintenance
- Our account manager is quick to respond
- It's easy to use for the most part so very little education was required for users when we launched

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
- There's no alert when you upload a file that already exists with the same name, so you end up with duplicates. Not helpful when you're doing a bulk upload and need to do a search for every single file in advance to make sure it doesn't already exist. We need to supercede previous versions instead of having a mix of old and new, so for that reason it doesn't seem very intuitive when it comes to version control.

-  It's often slow to load asset thumbnails. We've tried everything our acount manager said to help things load more quickly but even just loading the preview thumbnails for a folder of assets can take minutes.

- Reported a bug very early on (something that once worked but stopped working suddenly). There was technical support initially but they couldn't work it out so the helpdesk stopped contacting us with updates and the loop wasn't closed. Same thing when we wanted to establish a form and workflow - support waned and it was forgotten when we switched account managers.

- The reporting and analytics are really very basic. I do wish we had more set up support initially because I think reporting and other features would be more robust if we'd done a better job at the set up stage.

- There are a few other small quirks that I'm sure will be ironed out at some stage, like how you can't drag and drop when uploading a single asset, only for bulk uploads. That sort of thing can be annoying when you have a complex folder structure to navigate so drag and drop would be a lot easier.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
All digital assets in the one place and accessible to the whole company. Easy to search for assets with its advanced filtering and search capabilities. Previously we just had folders upon folders on a shared network so this is miles better.

review_question_answers.answer:
- There's no alert when you upload a file that already exists with the same name, so you end up with duplicates. Not helpful when you're doing a bulk upload and need to do a search for every single file in advance to make sure it doesn't already exist. We need to supercede previous versions instead of having a mix of old and new, so for that reason it doesn't seem very intuitive when it comes to version control.

-  It's often slow to load asset thumbnails. We've tried everything our acount manager said to help things load more quickly but even just loading the preview thumbnails for a folder of assets can take minutes.

- Reported a bug very early on (something that once worked but stopped working suddenly). There was technical support initially but they couldn't work it out so the helpdesk stopped contacting us with updates and the loop wasn't closed. Same thing when we wanted to establish a form and workflow - support waned and it was forgotten when we switched account managers.

- The reporting and analytics are really very basic. I do wish we had more set up support initially because I think reporting and other features would be more robust if we'd done a better job at the set up stage.

- There are a few other small quirks that I'm sure will be ironed out at some stage, like how you can't drag and drop when uploading a single asset, only for bulk uploads. That sort of thing can be annoying when you have a complex folder structure to navigate so drag and drop would be a lot easier.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: All digital assets in the one place and accessible to the whole company. Easy to search for assets with its advanced filtering and search capabilities. Previously we just had folders upon folders on a shared network so this is miles better.

all_reviews.review_title: Flexible and powerful when set up correctly
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I like the administration powers all being web-based, the flexibility of creating your own structures, and required fields. The layout is fairly intuitive, and the share functions flexible. The preview panels are large and easy to navigate. Customisable metadata and folder icons make navigation easier. The support team is relatively quick to respond and sort out any issues.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I have had users report differing speeds and slow searches on windows machines and using Microsoft Edge. There are limitations to working on files through plugins not necessarily apparent until you try using them. We optioned our pack based on designers' experience and keeping working files out of the DAM prior to making edits.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
The primary benefit is having a single source of truth for assets for the company and sharing to other departments or external sources. Tagging and editing data that doesn't exist on the files in the standard MS server settings, including extra information. Working remotely and having files accessible for the entire team.

all_reviews.review_title: IB shows flexibility and customization in early deployment phase.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Customer Support has been hands-on, and the onboarding phase has involved lots of questions, back and forth, and guidance. Multiple members of the IB team have been in nearly a dozen meetings with us as we prepare for launching our environment with complex needs.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Getting our existing assets transferred over was a significant hassle. However, this was more the fault of our old system than IB's. Also, their new AI facial recognition has some unexpected limitations and will require lots of front-end setup.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
For anyone looking to change DAM systems, know it will require a lot of time to clean up your existing assets. This is essential to setting yourself up for success after the transition. When you get further into implementation, be sure to ask detailed questions about your particular use case. Each implementation is unique and working through your situation on the front end will make a big difference.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have had a messy system for managing our photos in the past and struggled to sort and tag everything properly to be easily searchable. We are excited about the possibilities of IB's metadata structure, including the use of multiple layers of data (not just tags/EXIF), which should make it easier to drill down into specific properties, programs, and image types.

all_reviews.review_title: Worth it! Changed our process for the better.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank allowed us to find efficacies in managing our brand assets.  Prior to IB, we were housing our marketing photos, collateral, and graphics in a google drive which was not effective. This platform has enabled us to organize, monitor, and supervise the creation of digital assets and create a process for approval that was quick and reliable.  For multiple locations in our company, it is easy for us to communicate branding guidelines across locations and make sure the brand is being used correctly.

The entire team can use the system with ease, we've had a lot of positive feedback from everyone on the team with how easy it is to use. It's saved us countless hours and headaches in our marketing process. Even the customer service and platform support has been helpful whenever anyone on the team has a question about a feature!

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
There are a lot of ways to customize IntelligenceBank, my recommendation is to take your time with their account executives to really understand what you need with your company. They are quite a few features that they offered and it could be overwhelming if you don't communicate that. They will help you find the right fit for you and help build out exactly what your team needs.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Initially, we just wanted a tool to be able to organize and manage our digital assets. We shortly realized there were quite a few benefits of having a more tailored platform that IntelligenceBank offers that their peers do not. We quickly upgraded as our team grew to avoid headaches down the road.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Navigation could be a little bit more streamlined, particularly under the "Admin" tab. For example: the "People" and "Manage Users" sections are under separate menu items in the "Admin" dropdown. Those could probably be merged: I don't think I have ever successfully navigated to the "Manage Users" section on my first attempt.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a very geographically distributed organization and had a hard time managing our creative workflow (from licensing all the way to use in digital ad campaigns) before Intelligence Bank. Things run a lot smoother now.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and customise
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Online approvals of documents, alerts, registers replace spreadsheets, linking across modules, capability to integrate with Power BI. This is system is very customisable and easy to set up and use. The customer support is the best I have ever experienced both with knowledge and response time.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The biggest negatives are 1. missing the integration with Microsoft Office for online editing, 2. Register module missing a "Master" register capability to collate information from multiple registers. Other issues are lack of visual features eg. graphing of data in Data Reports. Dashboards feature is underdeveloped, compliance calendars do not function like a google calendar (eg. no reminders are sent on events).

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
This software has enabled us to digitalise our ISO9001 certified QMS as a result, it has been easy for integrating QMS into operations, therefore, minimising non-conformances and risks to compliance. The use of this system has streamlined processes increasing efficiencies with audits, document reviews and approvals and record keeping.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Features, Great Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
The ease-of-use and flexibility that Intelligence Bank offers within the platform. Love having the ability to customize pages and areas within the DAM to suit specific needs and teams. That, coupled with how easy and intuitive the platform has been for end users, has really helped prove its value. Love how well thought-out the UI is around the tools available for each asset. It's well organized and grouped.

Users have remarked at how easy the system is to use, often taking to it with very little instruction or guidance. By far their favorite features are the download presets and image cropping attributes. The ability to adjust an image's copping on a preset and export to numerous file types has been extremely helpful and has saved numerous requests into creative services for that type of work.

The customer service at Intelligence Bank has been outstanding. They have been a great partner, answering our many questions, listening to our feedback, and always being there to offer assistance if needed. We are a very hands-on, DIY organization and Intelligence Bank has been extremely patient and supportive of our desire to run with things.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The system is so robust and so flexible, it might be more than what some firms need. While there are certainly off-the-shelf options you can utilize, and Intelligence Bank's team is a huge help, smaller firms/teams without much skill or interest in dealing with "under-the-hood" options might be overwhelmed. There are also a lot of bolt-on options that cost extra, so you really need to understand what your needs are and what you're paying for upfront. The nice thing is that they're easy to work with and are super-generous when it comes to making sure you're satisfied.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Love how easy and intuitive their UI is. The robust search and filter features have helped make finding assets easy for users. The customizable template feature has allowed us to cut down on simple creative requests. Everything about this platform has helped us tremendously while teleworking - from sharing large asset files across teams to having one online instant access location for everyone to go to for things.

all_reviews.review_title: CKE Restaurants International Digitial Library Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank has provided our franchisees, cross-functional teams and agency partners with easy and reliable access to all of our numerous brand assets! We were able to customize  the site to match our brand guidelines, as well as structure the site to our liking. Having numerous employees and franchisees in 40+ countries, establishing a consistent layout and familiar structure is essential. It is also extremely helpful to be able to monitor and supervise who is accessing our assets, as well as how often the site is being accessed. The admin features of this platform are incomparable and something we didn't know would be so helpful. We have recieved compliment after compliment from our agency parters about the ease of uploading, as well as the perfectly organized folder structure. The intelligence bank team has thought of any and every element that could be included to make this platform effective. Additionally, the IT team is always prompt and alert whenever a inquiry is made. Our Customer Success Manager, Suzie, has walked us through every last step and answered all of our questions with ease! Her willingness to help us make our site most effective has made all the difference. As if the Library itself wasn't stand-out enough, the Intelligence Bank team makes it that much better - such a pleasure to partner with them on one of our biggest projects to date!

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Possibly my greatest dissapointment is that we didn't have this platform sooner! There is somewhat of a delay when accesing certain folders within the library, however, this is expected since we a multitude of large assets on the platform. I would also like to see a more user friendly zoom option when viewing certain photos.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Comb through your assets ahead of time, archive old items, build out a solid folder structure!

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Eliminating numerous email requests from franchisees & field employees to the HQ, thus allowing assets to be accessed easily and efficiently. Using sharing sites like dropbox or Wetransfer are time consuming and inefficient. Housing all of our assets in a "One stop
shop" has educated our franchisees on what consistant and reliable asset management looks like - eliminating the use of incorrect or dated assets.

all_reviews.review_title: So far, so good.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
We are just getting this off the ground and launched as it stands, but I will say- the system is very intuitive and has a lot of options that others could not replicate.

A few of our top favorites:
-you have a set number of "seats" that you can allocate according to your business need, so you can move them to different admin levels/groups as needed. Most other DAMs only allowed for a set number by permission group.
-There is a project management tool that can integrate, which other DAMs didnt offer that we are looking into for year 2+, but that was a nice feature as well.
-They offer a public portals for guests to view assets where we needed public visibility without a sign-on and registered user (Tech specs and product information type of assets).
-There are no limits to the number of groups we can create
-We can EASILY emulate a user's experience to view what they see and QA groups/permission settings for assets they should be seeing or should not. This wasn't available in several DAMs we vetted and the ease of which you can use this feature is great- total time saver!
-All in all the price was fairly comparable to others, but you can choose more alacarte options to make it fit your budget

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
These are a few of our top issues/dislikes at this time:
-First, a collection link is NOT dynamic (i'm being told this will be in the roadmap and rolled out this quarter, though). So, for instance, if you add a new asset to a collection and that person uses the link they already had, it will not populate the newest assets after that. We're hoping this rollout happens soon so those static links show dynamic assets in collections.
-Reporting/analytics is pretty basic- don't expect a ton of bells and whistles or graphs, but you can try to work around and get info you need. Would love to see a user engagement report (ie who is logging in and using the tool, what asset is viewed or shared the most- it only shows downloaded) etc.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
working remotely during covid and sharing assets digitally- gives one place for all our assets to be stored. no more on-premise server! we like that we can view asset data to see what our top pieces will be and to know if our time investment is worth it after we've shared it and can see the download activity.

all_reviews.review_title: A powerful digital asset management system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank Digital Asset Management allows users to search easily the information they need through key words, tags,... or the search engine. The tool is powerful as it can put together a wide variety of files, formats, and different size, even creative assets. Also Intelligence Bank developers are able to personalize the digital platform according to your needs, and not limit itself to the Digital Asset Management System, so if you need so they can implement other needs or create features or bridges with other tools.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The tool is quite powerful, and so can bring together a lot of files, but you need to think through the process the chosen files, folders... the idea is not put everything you have, but what you need. And that requires some work for the client. If you go down this path, you need to take time working step by step with Intelligence Bank. So I strongly recommend having a product owner for this kind of project, this is very important for the success of the project.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Name a product owner
Do your homework before: what are you trying to achieve in the first place, what is your main pain point
Who needs to be in the room to validate
What is your timeframe
Basic stuff for project management, but so important

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
It solves a number of problems, the first and main one being centralizing our tools and our date into one place. So we keep the house tidy, which can be a challenge in a very big organization and even more an international one. It also gives access to anybody in our system in the world, which is a really good point as internal digital systems can be a bit tricky sometimes.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool and great team to work with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I was drawn to IntelligenceBank for the customization available as well as the features and ease of use. I like that different companies can create a website that really looks and feels like an extension of their public site. I also felt that the search and filtering options would make it easy for our sales organization to find what they're looking for quickly and efficiently. The team has also been great to work with from on-boarding through account management. I also love the Collections function - one of the products we sell is highly visual, so I love that our sales organization can create a collection of photographs and technical data to send without bogging down someone's inbox.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I have had a few issues with user group permissions changing - but IntelligenceBank has been quick to help.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Previously our sales network made up of independent contractors didn't have consistent access to up-to-date marketing and sales materials. We were using OneDrive in the past, but since every sales rep has their own company, we found that permissions would expire. This has also given us a great way to organize this information, manage updates and house photos. I have received so many compliments on the site from its ease of use and just having one tool to house everything. As a marketing manager, this makes it easy for me to distribute the most up-to-date information to our internal and external partners.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Choice for Global Digital Asset Management
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
We were looking for a DAM for global team use (including China). IB has easy to use/customizable UX interface that makes it easy for wide mix of global users to engage. Also has great video and image cropping capability right within the software to save time and helpful in determnining our storage needs. Server network will also big plus for speed across all regions. Was extremely responsive during the sales process - moved at our speed to get from demo to proposal in less that 48 hours. We also got the Brand Hub - brand guidelines to help us put more discipline around our global brand standards.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Would be nice to have unlimited number of Brand Standards pages.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Make a list of what is important to you in features.Search function , ease of use were big for us.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have global marketing assets on  7+ servers which are not accessable and organize  well. Trying to get more efficient in time and spend to manage all these assets so global teams can better use.

all_reviews.review_title: I was impressed!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Intelligence Bank presented a multitude of features and benefits that was lacking in our current DAM system. From what I've seen, the UX and UI have the modality to customize a variety of experiences for our particular user. The ability to apply custom coding, integrate third party apps, and provide an array of administrative functions that would be useful for reporting and tracking.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
Since we have just begun our business relationship with Intelligence Bank, I don't have any immediate issues with the company.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Partnering with Intelligence Bank has given us one of the most important features, scalability. Our current DAM system does not have to ability to grow and thrive at the speed which we are progressing. We have outgrown the current DAM system and need a robust and elegant platform to keep up with our needs as we move forward. The current DAM system is mostly hard coded with limited features for any custom user experience. With Intelligence Bank, it seems that the possibilities are endless.

all_reviews.review_title: Efficient & organised DAM solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I really appreciate how simple Intelligence Bank is to learn and to use. We share this software across multiple offices, and we needed for all offices to be up-to-date with how to correctly source and manage digital assets. Not only did the Intelligence Bank team offer a great deal of support, but the software itself is fairly intuitive which meant our offices were able to get online and feel comfortable more quickly than expected. In particular, the keyword search bar at the top makes it easy to search for different assets - even new users can easily find their way around when logging in for the first time.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
The download function has a lot of features, but it would be good if there was a way to select/compare photos before downloading. Often, I like to find as many relevant photos as possible for a particular channel or communication before selecting the best one. Rather than download all the possibilities and have to then file/delete them from my desktop, I'd appreciate having this functionality on Intelligence Bank. The bulk upload and desktop upload features are quite slow too - though it's hard to judge whether this is because of our own internet connection or because of software limitations. While I prefer using the bulk upload tool in order to add keyword/filters to assets at the time of upload, it can be frustrating that there's a limit on the number of files able to be uploaded in one go. The desktop uploader has no such limit, but then lacks the ability to add keyword/filters.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
It's a great value solution for your Digital Asset Management. Other software are more powerful but are also much more expensive. I've found that Intelligence Bank provides excellent value for the funtionality provided. Bonus points for the number of users including in the basic package. Other DAMs allow far fewer users for much higher cost.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Intelligence Bank, we had too many assets stored in too many places, with not enough storage in any central place and too much double handling of data.  Intelligence Bank has streamlined our asset management procedures. We now have all digital assets including photos, videos, case studies, social media and reports stored in one, central location that's easily accessible by all and which has more than enough storage allowance at present, plus the ability to scale to meet our needs. We're also able to save time and prevent double handling for ourselves and our suppliers by uploading shareable information directly to our central asset base instead of to each office individually. This has the added benefit of ensuring every office is up-to-date and doesn't miss out on new updates.

all_reviews.review_title: I was blown away by its capabilities and innovative solutions
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
Two things stood out and liked best about IB. The ability to customize the system exactly how I envisioned it, both technically and aesthetically. And, the way IB has structured and engineered its system to adapt and connect to external applications and third-party software.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
This system is fantastic.  However, if there is one thing I could dislike about it, it would be the project management side of it. I'm not sold on how it handles project management.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
My advice to others looking into IB is to not hesitate and connect with one of their sales/consultants. No need to be shopping around when this system has everything you might need in one place. They will advise on what's best for your business and not pressure you into buying anything. But it's hard not to buy when everything you want is there for you!

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of the main problem-solvers for us was the ability to create/partition multiple asset portals for our partners. IB allows us to create a customized portal for each of our partners, making it easy for them to access their company files and assets. This feature saves us time and allows us to focus on partner expansion all across the U.S.

all_reviews.review_title: Staying one step ahead in the decision-making process
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
IB is, without doubt, the pre-eminent multi-media document management system in the world. The intuitive UX/UI ensures that I can focus on the task at hand, and not fight the system. This, coupled with the reliable back end tech ensures that the customisable platform is robust to sustain any level of client user group competency and most importantly, is scalable. As a portal owner and direct client of IB, I was most impressed by the company culture in the way that I received, what felt like, a personalised, almost bespoke concierge like, customer service. The team have a genuine interest and buy in to your success.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
That IB is not a mandated BAU platform throughout industry.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
It is intuitive, exceptional UX/UI, reliable tech with high level security protocols, great service and impeccable customer service.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
IB initially presented as a solution to a very real need for timely and accurate intelligence dissemination in a kinetic hostile operating environment. We required simultaneous dissemination across a broad range of UI of highly sensitive multi-media in often austere conditions. The inherent non-obtrusive security protocols within IB meant that international clients, Government departments, multi-national Defence organisations, our operations staff and operators on the ground were able to send and receive real-time intelligence and act accordingly.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing DAM w/ various capabilites. Still ironing out some kinks.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I like the ability to export out web-quality images from high-res images stored on the DAM. This has streamlined our web team's process of gathering images with appropriate specs for our website. I also love that you can control the visibility of images so that we ensure that no unedited images accidentally start circulating.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
I do not like that you can't yet export out multiple images at a time. Hoping this is coming soon.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
Give plenty of thought to the keywords and filters you want to grandfather into the DAM. This will greatly streamline finding your assets.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Organizing our assets all into one place has been a game changer. Before, our assets were all over the place - various hard drives, servers, and cloud storage systems. Now it's all under one roof and easily searchable with filters and keywords.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Storage and Search Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about IntelligenceBank?
I like the ability to tag and filter to be able to achieve precise search results. I like how easy it is to download photos, and having a preset to crop or resize photos is really helpful.

What do you dislike about IntelligenceBank?
One of the main reasons we went with this system is its ability to connect with InDesign. When the Adobe Connector is working, it is very helpful, but the connector isn't very reliable. I've been working with the Helpdesk, who has also been working directly with Adobe, to fix this issue. I also wish that I could add or bulk edit more than 100 images at a time.

Recommendations to others considering IntelligenceBank:
IntelligenceBank is a great tool. Make sure you are aware of how it fully integrates with any other software you are using.

What problems is IntelligenceBank solving and how is that benefiting you?
Searching for images within IntelligenceBank is much less time consuming than searching for images on our server. When the connector is working especially, our proposal process is more efficient.
